text: <http://www.hubspot.com/products/calls-to-action>
I just watched this video— looks like Hubspot actually provides some pretty robust CTA functionality— changing CTAs based on where people are in the sales funnel, built-in A/B testing…
yeah - they have some powerful stuff for sure
TI isn’t using any of it right now
i don’t know if this is just for sites that are entirely built on hubspot or not, or if we would be able to take advantage of it on a different platform…
and one thing I’m not wild about is how closely they’ve tied their analytics to their production systems - basically that you have to build your stuff in their system to leverage this functionality
yeah - you need to build the stuff in their system
lame
the good news is that GA offers all this functionality too
ah
well thats good news.
i need to take a GA crash course
me too :-)

text: i’ve gotten myself down a rabbithole reading blog posts on this site
hahahah
yeah - I find this stuff pretty fascinating
it’s so weird to read all of this conversion-centric stuff
i haven’t worked on a ton of projects where these principles apply, but it is pretty fascinating
and definitely applies on TI
yeah - that’s always been my issue with sites like this is that it’s never very adaptable
but I think in our case, just getting clients like TI thinking about this in a more complete way will really help
like - maybe top five headlines doesn’t matter to them - but thinking about how that stuff works, and thinking about tracking things LIKE that is important
like that none of TI’s marketing emails links back to their website
thats insane
and that they have no way of know who’s doing what from those marketing efforts
any way - Im with you, I really enjoy this stuff on an academic level, but when you get actually implement some of it, I think it gets really fun

These bullet points from that first Unbounce post are very relevant to TI as well:

basic guidelines that you should follow in your home page or landing page headlines:

Be specific
Be succinct
Focus on 1 thing that your prospects believe to be highly desirable (that you provide)
Quickly reflect the expectations of the visitor
emphasis on “focus on 1 thing"
yes
luckily hank is on board with that already
at least in spirit
